title: Augmented Reality (AR)-Based Instructional Design for Real-World Chemistry Concept Education

context.prior_knowledge: High school chemistry basics and undergraduate general chemistry course experience
context.additional_context: Blended course enhancing understanding and engagement by visualizing everyday chemical phenomena via AR technology, combining twice-weekly offline sessions with three weekly online AR activities

learning_goals: Learners accurately explain principles of chemical reactions (e.g., oxidation, neutralization) occurring in daily life using AR apps with over 80% accuracy
Learners propose optimal solutions to real-life problems (e.g., detergent selection, food preservation) presented in AR simulations based on scientific evidence
Learners create AR project deliverables applying chemical concepts and receive peer evaluation and feedback
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
